language.name: Turkmen
language.alternative-names: Trukhmen, Trukhmeny, Turkmani, Turkmanian, Turkmenler, Turkomans

lexeme.note: Loan from Arabic "ميدان [mjdan] - wide open space".
Loan from Persian "بهار [bhar] - spring; period between winter and summer".

language.name: Kumyk
language.alternative-names: Koumyk, Kumuk, Kumuklar, Kumyk, Kumyki, Kumyko

language.name: Azerbaijani
language.alternative-names: Azerbaijan, Azerbaydzhani, Azeri, Azeri Turk, Aderbeidjanisch, Azarbaydjanian, North Azerbaijani, Azerbaijanian, Turkler

semantics.note: To braid'. Also may mean 'to build'. For example, 'to build a wall' - "divarı hörmək [divarɯ hörmæç]".

lexeme.note: Mostly used in dialects (Culfa, Çənbərək, Gədəbəy, Gəncə, Goranboy, Qazax, Naxçıvan, Ordubad, Salyan, Şəmkir, Şərur, Tovuz).

semantics.note: Means age between chicken and hen. In explanatory dictionary of Azerbaijani it is like "young hen".

lexeme.note: Arabic loanword "شراب [šrb] - all kinds of drinks, especially alchoholic".
Persian loanword "بهار [bhar] - spring; period between winter and summer".
Persian loanword " جانور [ǯanavar] - animal, vermin, monster".

language.name: Tuvan
language.alternative-names: Diba, Karangas, Kök Mungak, Soyod, Soyon, Soyot, Tannu-Tuva, Tofa, Tokha, Touvain, Tuba, Tuva, Tuvan, Tuvia, Tuvin, Tuvinian, Uriankhai, Uriankhai-Monchak, Uryankhai

language.name: Southern Altai
language.alternative-names: Altai, Oirot, Oyrot, Altai, Altai-Kalmückisch, Altay, Altaï méridional, Altái meridional, South Siberian Turkic

source.full-citation: Ширинова, Насият. (1996). Лексика Будухского языка (диссертация кандидата филологических наук). Махачкала.

Чарыяров, Б. & Алтаев, C. (eds.) (1986). Большой Русско-Туркменский Словарь: В 2-х т./АН ТССР, Ин-т яз. Рус. яз.

Crimean Tatar native speaker Leniiara Dzhelilova
